info.author: Erik Max Francis
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU General Public License (GPL)
Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
Provided is an implementation of a "unique" ID generator in
    Python.  The implementation does not follow UUID or GUID
    standards, but rather uses available system, host, user, shell
    environment, process, and other ephemeral information fed into a
    hasher (by default MD5) to generate the ID.

    The system is designed to be used both as a standalone application
    and as a module.  The data used to be fed into the hash, as well
    as the hashing mechanism itself, can be overridden both through
    the command line and programmatically by importing the module.
info.name: PyUID
info.html_description:
Provided is an implementation of a “unique” ID generator in

Python. The implementation does not follow UUID or GUID standards, but rather uses available system, host, user, shell environment, process, and other ephemeral information fed into a hasher (by default MD5) to generate the ID.

The system is designed to be used both as a standalone application and as a module. The data used to be fed into the hash, as well as the hashing mechanism itself, can be overridden both through the command line and programmatically by importing the module.
